message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(outputStream);
dos.writeUTF(username.getText());
dos.writeUTF(password.getText());
// On the server side
DataInputStream dis = new DataInputStream(inputStream);
String user = dis.readUTF();
String pass = dis.readUTF();
<<<explanation>>>: The DataOutputStream.writeUTF() method writes a string to the output stream in a modified UTF-8 format. This method first writes the length of the string as an unsigned short, then writes the string characters in UTF-8 format. On the server side, you can use the DataInputStream.readUTF() method to read the strings. This method first reads the length of the string, then reads the string characters in UTF-8 format. This way, you can send and receive multiple strings without needing a delimiter.
